FuncDef:
The dhcpc unicast-flag enable command sets the Bootp flags field value in a DHCP request message to 0x0000 (Unicast).
The undo dhcpc unicast-flag enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the Bootp flags field value in a DHCP request message is 0x8000 (Broadcast).
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, DHCP request and response messages are broadcast ones. If the client requires the server to respond in unicast mode for security, run the dhcpc unicast-flag enable command to set the Bootp flags field value in a DHCP request message to 0x0000 (Unicast) before enabling the DHCP client function.
